description.narrative: Ukraines implementation of the three Rio Conventions on a strengthened policy and institutionally sustainable development baseline is catalyzed.

A To integrate principles and obligations of the three Rio Conventions into Ukraines national policy framework B To strengthen key institutional and individual capacities to implement policies plans and programmes that deliver global environmental benefits

Rio Convention obligations are an integral part of the Sustainable Development Strategy
SDS Roadmap is an overarching plan of action for the environmental and sectoral action plans
The Government of Ukraine and a wide range of stakeholders systematically review natural resource and environmental policies in a holistic manner in line with Rio Conventions requirements
Recommended reforms and restructuring per the SDS are presented for parliamentary consideration

comment.narrative:
There is no overarching policy that links the Rio Conventions win the framework of national sustainable development
Requirements of the Rio Conventions are not effectively integrated into sectoral legislation
There is little interministerial coordination on the implementation of natural resource and environmental policies
Policy interventions often result in overlap duplication of effort and weak implementation
There is limited stakeholder involvement in the consultative process that informs policymaking

A draft Sustainable Development Strategy has been approved by the Cabinet of Ministers and ready for Parliamentary consideration for adoption
A draft SDS Roadmap has been approved by the Cabinet of Ministers
There is a minimum of 20 increase in the understanding of the Rio Convention mainstreaming among government staff
There is a minimum of 15 increase in the appreciation of the Rio Conventions among the general public
There is a minimum of 25 increase in the acceptance by government representatives and other stakeholder representatives of the legitimacy of the SDS and its accompanying Roadmap

Almost all national stakeholders target ministries in particular demonstrate political will to review the current policies and align them with the Sustainable Development concept international obligations This is especially topical for Ukraine now in the view of the countrys commitment to approximate its legislative and normative frameworks to the EU requirements
Nongovernmental partners stay actively involved in the project and stand ready to support further activities specifically on the way to develop the Sustainable Development Strategy SDS based on evidences and best practices from the neighboring European countries
The project is actively promoting knowledge and handson examples of implementation of the Rio Conventions among the key stakeholders
